summary: Western Europe is the western part of the European continent. The idea of "the West" started in ancient times, referring to the Mediterranean region and the Roman Empire. Over time, it became more about the cultural and religious identity of "Christendom." During the Renaissance and later, the concept of Western Europe developed, especially during the Cold War when Europe was divided into Eastern and Western blocs. This division emphasized the political and economic differences between these regions.
title: Western Europe
